channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Army asks NBI to probe ex-soldier shooting over alleged 'prejudgement' by police
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The Philippine Army on Friday asked the National Bureau of Investigation to conduct an impartial probe on the fatal shooting case of retired soldier Winston Rago involving Quezon City police earlier this week.

item.title: BuCor records two new COVID-19 cases in women's prison
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The Bureau of Corrections on Friday reported two new COVID-19 infections in the Correctional Institution for Women, bringing tally at the women’s prison to 22.

item.title: UNICEF: 2 million Filipino kids at risk of missing vaccinations due to COVID-19 crisis
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The United Nations Children’s Fund stressed that life-saving health interventions such as immunization cannot be neglected as authorities attempt to contain the spread of the virus that has already infected 7,192 people in the Philippines.

item.title: DOJ: Government to process 200 parole, executive clemency applications weekly
item.description: With these relaxed rules, including putting reducing the minimum age for executive clemency application to 65 years old from 70,“significant number” of prisoners can apply for release, Justice Undersecretary Markk Perete said.

item.title: COVID-19 cases exceed 7,000 as gov't extends lockdown in Metro Manila, other 'high-risk' areas
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Update 1, 5:44 p.m.) To date, 7,192 people have contracted the virus that causes coronavirus disease with the addition of 211 cases.

item.title: NPA a 'convenient excuse' for admin's failures vs COVID-19 — CPP
item.author: Artemio Dumlao
item.description: While condemning renewed threats to declare Martial Law, the Communist Party of the Philippines on Friday took its armed wing — the New People's Army — exception from being a perennial excuse for government’s failures.

item.title: DILG: Local chief execs can't declare ECQ sans IATF approval
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Local government units must seek the approval of the Interagency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Disease before they could declare enhanced community quarantine in their municipalities, cities or provinces.

item.title: Philippines to test if virgin coconut oil can aid recovery of COVID-19 patients
item.description: DOST Secretary Fortunato Dela Peña said clinical trials of virgin coconut oil aim to see if it could speed up the recovery of people infected with the new coronavirus.

item.title: Homicide complaint filed against cop who shot ex-soldier Ragos
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: (Updated) Police have a filed homicide complaint against MSgt. Daniel Florendo who fatally shot former soldier Winston Ragos for supposedly violating quarantine guidelines.

item.title: DepEd to present school opening recommendation to COVID-19 task force in May
item.description: (Update 1, 1:37 p.m.) The Department of Education will present its recommendation on the opening of the next school year to the Inter-Agency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Diseases on the first week of May.
